summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 regarding a signed 6(e) order in the Epstein case. A clerk from Judge Alison Nathan's chambers notifies the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York that the order is ready for pickup, and the email is forwarded internally to coordinate retrieval.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed the 6(e) order in the Epstein case. Her clerk notified the U.S. Attorney's Office that the order was ready for pickup from her chambers.

events.title: Judge Nathan Signs 6(e) Order
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan signed a 6(e) order in the Epstein case, and her clerk notified the U.S. Attorney's Office that it was ready to be picked up from her chambers.

keyFacts: A 6(e) order in the Epstein case was signed by Judge Alison Nathan.
The order was ready for pickup from Judge Nathan's chambers as of January 31, 2020.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was coordinating the retrieval of the signed order.
